The Sacred Harp Concordance

The Sacred Harp Concordance
An index to every word and verse in The Sacred Harp, 1991 Edition

Second printing, December 16, 2013
Copyright © 1992-2013 Chris Thorman, editor
You may share this work under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/

Thanks to the Sacred Harp Publishing Company http://originalsacredharp.com/ for permission to republish copyrighted poetry in this format. Thanks also to Carolyn Deacy and Mark Miller for reviewing the second printing, and Laura Akerman, Martha Henderson, Daniel Kelley, Robert Kelley, John Martin, Berkley Moore, Gaylon Powell, Michael Spencer, and others who have offered typographical corrections to the first and second printings.

The 554 songs in The Sacred Harp contain 5,747 distinct lines of poetry and 3,538 distinct words. 3,460 have entries in this book, while these 78 very common words are omitted for brevity:

a, all, am, an, and, are, as, at, be, but, by, can, do, for, from, go, have, he, her, here, him, his, how, I, if, in, is, it, its, let, may, me, my, no, not, now, of, Oh, on, or, our, out, shall, she, should, so, such, than, that, the, their, them, then, there, they, thine, this, those, thy, to, too, unto, up, upon, us, was, we, what, when, where, which, while, who, will, with, would, you, your.

Visit http://fasola.org/concordance/ for ordering information and free online and PDF versions of this book.

The Sacred Harp Concordance

abate

So ready to abate.

36t America

abide

And in peace e’ermore abide.

494 Big Creek

Joys that from all time abide.

532 Peace and Joy

There everlasting springs abide,

303 Heavenly Land

Thus may we abide in union

56t Columbiana

abides

There everlasting spring abides,

289 Greensborough

392 Manchester

446 Infinite Day

able

And I shall be able forever to stand.

179 The Christian Warfare

And who shall be able to stand?

250 Heavenly Vision

And yet she is able to land still more,

79 The Old Ship of Zion

But she is able to land us all home.

79 The Old Ship of Zion

He is able,

81t Beach Spring

abode

And I’d praise God in His bright abode.

106 Ecstasy

Formed thee for His own abode.

148 Jefferson

He left His exalted abode,

104 The Lovely Story

I hold my frail abode

39b Sharpsburg

Is an abode of my delight.

174 Petersburg

My feet shall visit Thine abode,

298 Providence

Removes His blest abode;

409 Promised Day

Thou art our rest, our safe abode;

142 Stratfield

Thy much loved abode, and the land of thy birth;

231 Thou Art Passing Away

To heav’n the place of His abode,

527 My Life and Breath

To His divine abode.

372 Rockport

To seek her last abode.

29b Tribulation

419 Melancholy Day

Up to His blest abode.

385t Fight On

Upwards tends to His abode

84 Amsterdam

Within Thy blest abode,

540 Nidrah

abound

And make His grace abound.

157 Essay

And peace and goodwill to the nations abound.

160t War Department

In springs of water may abound,

64 Nashville

Let peace and love on earth abound,

412 New Hosanna

Sisters, let your prayers abound;

59 Holy Manna

Then let our songs abound,

313t Concord

481 Novakoski

565 The Hill of Zion

Then let your songs abound,

220 Mount Zion

Thy ways abound with blessings still,

344 Rainbow

Where trouble shall cease and harmony shall abound.

260 Farewell Anthem

Where true joys abound;

369 Send A Blessing

abounding

Be His abounding mercy praised,

500 Living Hope

abounds

My father’s house abounds with bread,

113 The Prodigal Son

My soul abounds with joy to know

286 Heavenly Home

387 Penick

about

About our loving Savior;

355 Anthem on the Savior

He was going about doing good;

355 Anthem on the Savior

Tell them all about the Savior,

59 Holy Manna

To the children about

507 Sermon on the Mount

above

Above my foes around

91 Assurance

Above the ground we tread,

36t America

I’m going home to Christ above;

111b To Die No More

And all the glorious ranks above,

362 Norwich

536 Sweet Majesty

And bright above the sun

354b Happy Land

And dwell with my Savior above.

240 Christian Song

And God grant we may meet together in that world above,

260 Farewell Anthem

And have laid up their treasures above;

399b Happy Christian

And learn that wisdom from above

379 Span of Life

407 Charlton

And ours above the sky.

28t Aylesbury

And plead my cause above.

393 Alexander

And reign with Him above?

82t Bound For Canaan

85 The Morning Trumpet

106 Ecstasy

319 Religion Is a Fortune

410b Mutual Love

And rolls through my soul from the mansions above.

360 The Royal Band

And shine above the skies.

44 The Converted Thief

And soon we’ll meet above.

83b The Dying Minister

348t Ainslie

By faith we know a world above,

206 Christian’s Hope

Come, let us join our friends above

285t Arnold

Come, my dear Jesus, from above,

280 Westford

For better friends above.

288 White

From all below, and all above,

538 Hampton

Glory to God who reigns above,

152 Shepherds Rejoice

He lives to plead my cause above;

277 Antioch

He’ll carry you above.

85 The Morning Trumpet

106 Ecstasy

He’ll take you up above.

129 Heavenly Armor

How happy are the souls above,

403 Heavenly Rest

How long my hopes of joys above;

278t Love Shall Never Die

I’d fly to see my God above.

455 Soar Away

I’d soar away above the sky,

455 Soar Away

In heav’n above, where all is love,

426b Jasper

In that sweet home above.

389 Fredericksburg

Is like to that above.

330b Fellowship

Lord, above, may we go praying,

80t Shouting Song

My glorious home above.

312t Sing to Me of Heaven

My home in heav’n above.

235 Long Sought Home

Never did angels taste above,

280 Westford

None richer possessed by the angels above;

125 Expression

Not all the harps above,

147t Boylston

Oh mercy! Oh mercy! look down from above,

149 The Trumpet

One church above, beneath.

285t Arnold

Rest upon us from above.

56t Columbiana

Seal it for Thy courts above.

145t Warrenton

Seek the things that are above;

523 Pleyel’s Hymn

Send it down, Lord, from above.

323t Mullins

Shall live and sing His praise above,

426b Jasper

Shout, Oh glory! for I shall mount above the skies,

85 The Morning Trumpet

Sung by flaming tongues above;

135 Olney

312b Restoration

333 Family Circle

Sweet Redeemer from above,

497 Natick

The Lord descended from above,

291 Majesty

Then I shall live in heav’n above,

560 My Home

There is a holy city, a happy world above,

101b Holy City

There is a life above,

499 At Rest

To guide my weary feet above,

206 Christian’s Hope

To heav’n above shall fly.

177 The Christian’s Flight

To praise His name above.

109 Carnsville

To seats prepared above.

84 Amsterdam

131b Invocation

To see my God above,

455 Soar Away

To sing above, as angels do,

266 Kingwood

To that celestial world above,

101t Canaan’s Land

We all ere long shall meet above.

185 Pilgrim’s Farewell

We’ll praise the Lord in heav’n above,

274b Roll Jordan

With all the sainted hosts above,

530 A Glad New Song

Abraham

There was Abraham and Isaac, and Jacob and David,

116 Union

abroad

And pour my woes abroad.

476 The Throne of Grace

And sheds His love abroad.

540 Nidrah

And sound His name abroad.

182 Newburgh

Awake, asleep, at home, abroad,

315 Immensity

472 Akin

Came flying all abroad.

291 Majesty

Come, shed abroad a Savior’s love,

371 Heavenly Dove

Come, sound His praise abroad,

34b St. Thomas

169 Dartmouth

311 Silver Street

May speak their joys abroad.

31b Webster

52t Albion

My tongue shall sound Thy works abroad,

187 Protection

Stretch all thy thoughts abroad,

313b Cobb

To spread through all the earth abroad

88b Mount Zion

350 Nativity

395 New Bethel

Absalom

For thee, Oh Absalom, my son.”

268 David’s Lamentation

absenting

Like thoughts of absenting myself for a day

100 The Bower of Prayer

absorbs

What is this absorbs me quite —

245 Claremont

abused

And she must not be abused,

115 Edmonds

accent

He caught the first accent that fell from thy tongue,

413 The Loved Ones

accept

Wilt Thou not accept my prayer?

452 Martin

acceptable

Be acceptable in Thy sight, Oh Lord,

518 Heavenly Anthem

accepted

In this accepted day,

96 Few Happy Matches

accord

And join with one accord,

157 Essay

Come, let us join with one accord,

283 Sabbath Morning

Join in a song with sweet accord,

31b Webster

52t Albion

481 Novakoski

We have met in sweet accord;

477 Lord, We Adore Thee

We’ll shout and sing with one accord,

62 Parting Hand

381 Sing On

516 DeLong

We’ll sing around the throne in sweet accord,

454 The Better Land

account

A strict account to give.

502 A Charge to Keep

How stands that dark account?

321 Newnan

Who such a strict account must give

445 Passing Away

aching

But they have left an aching void

27 Bethel

My aching breast inspire.

535 Shawmut

Please raise my aching head,

398 The Dying Boy

across

Across my peaceful breast.

act

And in the act of dying gave up the ghost,

active

Will soon your active limbs enclose.

Adam

From Adam’s feet, we see;

115 Edmonds

From Adam’s head, we know;

115 Edmonds

From near to Adam’s heart,

115 Edmonds

From under Adam’s arm;

115 Edmonds

When Adam was created,

115 Edmonds

adamant

All but an adamant would melt;

93 Frozen Heart

address

Address the Lord on high,

200 Edom

301 Greenland

304 Morgan

528 Showers of Blessings

Loud hallelujahs shall address

492 Invocation

My songs address Thy throne.

298 Providence

My thoughts address His throne,

203 Florida

While I address you in God’s name.

204 Mission

addressed

And thus his prayer addressed.

44 The Converted Thief

Her honored mother she addressed,

37t Ester

adds

Adds more luster to the day.

532 Peace and Joy

adieu

Adieu, ye proud, ye light and gay,

89 The Church’s Desolation

But when I come to bid adieu

83t Vale of Sorrow

Farewell my friends, adieu, adieu,

122 All Is Well

I bid them both adieu!

85 The Morning Trumpet

I bid you all adieu,

129 Heavenly Armor

My friends, I bid you all adieu;

235 Long Sought Home

Thou earth and thou ocean, adieu;

123t The Dying Christian

Vain world, adieu.

329 Vain World Adieu

admiration

Till, to his admiration,

115 Edmonds

admiring

To our admiring eye.

121 Florence

admitted

Henceforth till admitted to see my Lord’s face.

369 Send A Blessing

adore

And adore the Lord our God;

59 Holy Manna

And bid my soul adore.

138t Adoration

And the lover of sinners adore.

399b Happy Christian

His great name for to adore.

144 Jubilee

Instantly adore Him.

139 Elysian

Magnify and adore,

355 Anthem on the Savior

That mercy I adore.

143 Pleyel’s Hymn

Then we shall adore and wonder,

210 Lena

There we our Jesus shall adore

460 Sardis

Through everlasting years adore.

434 Fillmore

Your Lord and King adore!

473 Carmarthen

adored

Adored a chast’ning God,

379 Span of Life

His majesty adored.

500 Living Hope

adores

In humble notes our faith adores

351 Pittsford

adoring

Adoring Jesus our dear Lord.

454 The Better Land

adorn

Flowers adorn the narrow bed

340 Odem

Of joy adorn my way;

75 I Would See Jesus

adorned

Adorned a great apostle.

207 Louisiana

Adorned with shining grace.

155 Northfield

299 New Jerusalem

And rites adorned with gold.

28t Aylesbury

advice

While blessed with parental advice and affection,

165 Family Bible

342 The Old-Fashioned Bible

advocate

Thou wondrous advocate with God,

58 Pisgah

affect

And folly and fashion affect our whole time,

136 Morality

affection

While blessed with parental advice and affection,

165 Family Bible

342 The Old-Fashioned Bible

affections

And my affections cold.

141 Complainer

How few affections there.

278t Love Shall Never Die

affects

And go from my home it affects not my heart

100 The Bower of Prayer

afflicted

For his afflicted foes!

296 Sardinia

430 Arbacoochee

When sorely afflicted and ready to faint,

496 The Rock That is Higher Than I

affliction

On whom in affliction I call;

571 Penitence

afflictions

Afflictions, though they seem severe,

113 The Prodigal Son

In all my afflictions to Thee would I come,

119 Heaven’s My Home

Where sore afflictions come,

286 Heavenly Home

387 Penick

afford

Can one delight afford;

503 Lloyd

Joys which earth cannot afford.

56t Columbiana

Now to me afford Thine aid.

52b Charlestown

56b Villulia

458 Friendship

That may joy and peace afford;

70t Gainsville

affrighted

Th’affrighted nations hear the sound,

131t Messiah

afraid

Who sometimes am afraid to die,

96 Few Happy Matches

after

After the soul is gone.

340 Odem

And after death Thy boundless grace

434 Fillmore

I hope to praise Him after death.

170 Exhilaration

I long to praise Him after death.

544 Praise Him

I saw joy after joy successive rise

227 Ode on Life’s Journey

Or the clouds return after the rain,

512 The Spirit Shall Return

’Tis then I after glory run,

406 New Harmony

again

Again for joy she claps her wings,

329 Vain World Adieu

And hope to meet again.

330b Fellowship

And never, never part again.

94 Never Part

And should we never meet again

72t The Weary Soul

And we shrink back again to life,

30b Prospect

But let me find them all again,

146 Hallelujah

383 Eternal Day

But let them think and think again,

406 New Harmony

But when He doth again return,

406 New Harmony

From Him no more again to roam,

373 Homeward Bound

I fear that I’m not born again.

317 Jackson

I hope we’ll meet again.

521 Parting Friends

I long to see my friends again

418 Reese

453 Holly Springs

I want to sing His praises once again,

548 Wootten

I’ll tune my harp again.

126 Babel’s Streams

Jesus, the dead, revives again.

163t Morning

May it never cease again.

322 Man’s Redemption

No, never part again.

94 Never Part

Now He again is born.

273 Milford

Perhaps never to meet again,

267 Parting Friends

Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!

473 Carmarthen

Say do you wish to turn again?

42 Clamanda

Shall e’er disturb our rest again,

460 Sardis

Shall we ever meet again at the house,

46 Let Us Sing

The broken heart to cheer again,

334 Oh Come Away

The Lamb that was slain, but lives again

309 Living Lamb

Till dying hope revives again,

32b Distress

Till we all shall meet again.

323t Mullins

To revive His work again.

144 Jubilee

Turn o’er my pillow once again,

398 The Dying Boy

Unless Thou return again.

335 Return Again

Waking the echoes again!

323b Soft Music

What? never part again.

94 Never Part

Which makes me hope we’ll meet again.

62 Parting Hand

516 DeLong

Yet again we hope to meet thee,

118 Stockwood

Yet the Lord invites again!

144 Jubilee

against

Against the people of His love,

49b Mear

Hoping against hope I stand,

452 Martin

No longer fight against your God;

404 Youth Will Soon Be Gone

Now against the Bridegroom fight,

495 The Midnight Cry

Should earth against my soul engage,

36b Ninety-Fifth

43 Primrose Hill

114 Saint’s Delight

293 Akers

423 Grantville

Some sure support against despair.

73t Cusseta

age

And well support our age.

517 Mars Hill

Ere age arrives, and trembling waits

176b Blooming Youth

Let’s live so in youth that we blush not in age.

136 Morality

Our age to sev’nty years is set;

50t Mortality

181 Exit

Through ev’ry age eternal God,

142 Stratfield

To serve the present age,

502 A Charge to Keep

When age, old creeping age comes on,

98 Dull Care

’Twill fit us for declining age

205 Pleasant Hill

ages

As in the ages past;

534 New Georgia

Long as eternal ages roll.

48b Kedron

On the Rock of Ages founded,

148 Jefferson

Our God, our help in ages past,

336 Eternal Home

Where ceaseless ages roll.

505 Where Ceaseless Ages Roll

Where endless ages roll.

266 Kingwood

agonizing

Agonizing in the garden,

81t Beach Spring

agony

Thy last expiring agony,

48b Kedron

agree

Kindred and friends agree,

212 Sharon

ah

Ah, my Lord, Thou know’st my name:

74b King of Peace

Ah, they are of a royal line,

229 Irwinton

Ah! we’re much to blame,

98 Dull Care

Ah! what is this drawing my breath,

240 Christian Song

Leave, ah! leave me not alone,

452 Martin

aid

Ever near Thine aid to lend,

510 Corley

God is our all-sufficient aid.

26 Samaria

107 Russia

I, I am thy God, and will still give thee aid;

72b Bellevue

No more demands thy aid.

112 The Last Words of Copernicus

Now to me afford Thine aid.

52b Charlestown

56b Villulia

458 Friendship

Thy friendly crook shall give me aid,

402 Protection

To aid and direct me, then all will be right;

179 The Christian Warfare

aided

Moses’ sisters aided him;

59 Holy Manna

aim

Come, join us in our holy aim,

334 Oh Come Away

Where few can reach the purposed aim,

227 Ode on Life’s Journey

air

And saints will rise to meet Him in the air.

498 The Resurrection Day

Are waving in the air,

438 The Marriage in the Skies

Cold mountains and the midnight air

515 Federal Street

Flying in the air.

225b Christmas Anthem

Glide through the midnight air,

184 Enfield

Nor blasts of evening air,

216 Delight

Of modest air and brow serene!

140 Sweet Solitude

Pleasant as the air of ev’ning,

118 Stockwood

The Lord of earth, and air and sky.

168 Cowper

To call me to duty, while birds of the air

100 The Bower of Prayer

airy

Wrapped in sweet vision’s airy dream.

140 Sweet Solitude

alarm

But do not fear alarm,

55 Sister’s Farewell

alarms

And shall the world, with dread alarms,

42 Clamanda

I shield thee from alarms,

489 The Savior’s Call

Or shake at death’s alarms?

163b China

alas

Alas and did my Savior bleed?

290 Victoria

310 Weeping Savior

375 Love the Lord

Crying, “Oh alas, alas.”

117 Babylon Is Fallen

How changed, alas! are truths divine,

354t Lebanon

alike

Alike to one and all.

367 Consolation

Alike unknowing and unknown.

28b Wells

Alike we’re made of clay;

98 Dull Care

Where the rich and poor are both alike.

260 Farewell Anthem

alive

Once she was all alive to Thee

89 The Church’s Desolation

The dead’s alive, and the lost is found,

277 Antioch

Alleluia

Alleluia to Jesus who died on the tree,

551 Jacob’s Vision

almighty

Almighty love inspires my heart,

178 Africa

Holy, holy, Lord God Almighty,

250 Heavenly Vision

Loud thanks to our Almighty King.

49t Old Hundred

Praise Him by whose almighty word,

394 The Messiah’s Praise

Shout His almighty name, ye choirs of angels,

223 Portuguese Hymn

The work of the almighty hand.

468 Bristol

’Tis He, by His almighty grace,

418 Reese

almost

I’m almost done traveling,

294 Rocky Road

He’s almost done traveling,

294 Rocky Road

In notes almost divine.

396 Notes Almost Divine

Is but esteemed almost a saint,

38b Windham

My days on earth are almost gone,

549 Phillips Farewell

alms

Alms which none but he could give.

56b Villulia

alone

And I am left alone with Thee.

95 Vernon

But seemed as one alone,

115 Edmonds

Coos the turtle dove alone.

188 Spring

Dear sister, thou art left alone,

55 Sister’s Farewell

For sov’reign pow’r reign not alone,

26 Samaria

“Glory give to God alone,

139 Elysian

“How sweetly he sleeps here alone.”

341 The Lone Pilgrim

In heav’n alone no sin is found,

Leave, ah! leave me not alone,

Like one alone I seem to be,

My spirit looks to God alone,

26 Samaria

Sufficient is Thine arm alone,

’Tis on Thy sov’reign grace alone,

354t Lebanon

To lean alone on Thine.

75 I Would See Jesus

To Thee, and Thee alone,

147t Boylston

Where Jesus reigns alone.

328 Praise God

along

Along the extended plain.

227 Ode on Life’s Journey

Along the rugged maze?

229 Irwinton

Come, and taste, along with me,

326 Weary Pilgrim

Delight I find along the way,

373 Homeward Bound

Farewell, my friends, time rolls along,

185 Pilgrim’s Farewell

He safely leads my song along,

275t Loving Kindness

It guides us as we go along

488 As We Go On

Oft along the flow’ry vale.

450 Elder

Perfumes as of Eden flowed sweetly along,

358 Murillo’s Lesson

That prayed as they journeyed along;

116 Union

Why don’t they come along?

331 Jester

You can share along the way of love.

491 Oh, What Love

aloof

Oh, that my heart might dwell aloof

Aloud will I rejoice.

Shout, shout aloud for glory,

We will shout aloud and sing,

already

I have already come;

45t New Britain

Than what is already done?

also

Some tell us that praying, and also that praising

I’ll build an altar to His name,

although

Although I’m with you now, my friends,

521 Parting Friends

Although he no relenting felt

Although they’re drowned in vice,

always

Always rolling to its sea;

450 Elder

Are always well worthwhile.

I should, were He always thus nigh,

amazing

45t New Britain

Then shouting and praising, they cry, “’Tis amazing;

360 The Royal Band

Perish, ev’ry fond ambition,

America

242 Ode on Science

American

346 The American Star

amiable

How amiable they are;

147t Boylston

503 Lloyd

amid

’Mid sands and rocks your Shepherd’s voice,

279 The Shepherd’s Flock

’Mid scenes of confusion and creature complaints,

161 Sweet Home

’Mid storms and distresses my soul shall rely

496 The Rock That is Higher Than I

’Mid storms of doubt, in grief or woe,

367 Consolation

“Amid the glories of that world,

44 The Converted Thief

Amid Thy gates their ensigns hang,

49b Mear

And honored him ’mid shame and scorn.

164 Duane Street

In that last sad hour, ’mid friends so dear,

494 Big Creek

amidst

Amidst our youthful bloom;

205 Pleasant Hill

Amidst thereof we hung our harps,

126 Babel’s Streams

While high amidst, the silent orb,

184 Enfield

among

Among the children of Thy grace,

540 Nidrah

Among the favored few.

67 Columbus

Among the foll’wers of the Lamb.

515 Federal Street

Among the wicked crew,

67 Columbus

Among them clothed in white.

562 Infinite Delight

And sets her sons among the stars.

242 Ode on Science

As the apple tree among the trees of the wood,

254 Rose of Sharon

As the lily among the thorns,

254 Rose of Sharon

Chiefest among ten thousand,

438 The Marriage in the Skies

Shall I among them stand?

96 Few Happy Matches

So is my beloved among the sons.

254 Rose of Sharon

So is my love among the daughters

254 Rose of Sharon

Some cast among lions, some bound with rough irons,

116 Union

When it flows among the trees,

118 Stockwood

anchor

Her anchor drops within the veil.

329 Vain World Adieu

We’ll anchor by and by.

378t Heavenly Port

ancient

Before the birth of ancient times,

431 New Bethany

That death should yield his ancient reign

562 Infinite Delight

anew

And form me all anew.

33b Abbeville

He forms the sinful man anew,

478 My Rising Sun

angel

A mighty angel cries,

438 The Marriage in the Skies

An angel’s song can do no more.

168 Cowper

And I heard a mighty angel

250 Heavenly Vision

Angel trumps resound His fame,

139 Elysian

The angel of the Lord came down,

186 Sherburne

461 Shining Star

We soon shall hear the angel’s voice,

473 Carmarthen

angelic

Angelic armies tune their harps,

225b Christmas Anthem

Come, favor my flight, angelic band,

449 Fatherland

Notes angelic loud rebounding,

210 Lena

angels

A voice as of angels enchantingly sung,

358 Murillo’s Lesson

And all the angels bid them come,

421 Sweet Morning

And go where saints and angels dwell,

134 The Christian’s Hope

And praising and blessings, with angels on high,

496 The Rock That is Higher Than I

And the angels could do nothing more;

399b Happy Christian

And the angels stand inviting,

92 Burk

And there with saints and angels join,

568 I Want to Go to Heaven

Angels in shining order stand,

196 Alabama

Angels rolled the rock away,

415 Easter Morn
